value: Its hallmark is the large mural, created by Manuel Sierra, which covers its entire facade and features various Vaccean iconographic motifs. It was inaugurated by the Magnificent Rector on September 21, 2001, and has since become a crucial support for the Pintia Project. This project aims to protect, research, and disseminate the exceptional archaeological heritage housed in the Pintia Archaeological Zone. If you wish to contact the CEVFW, you can do so through the contact page.

The center is named after a professor from the University of Valladolid, who passed away prematurely in 1967. He laid the foundation for the study of the Vaccean people with his work *The Vaccean Region: Celtiberianism and Romanization in the Middle Duero Basin*, which marked its 50th anniversary in 2009. To commemorate this, the CEVFW paid a heartfelt tribute and erected a commemorative monolith in his memory at the Pintian cemetery of Las Ruedas.
